China: The Xianbei Murong Huang declared himself prince of Former Yan.
Italy: Romanâ€“Persian Wars: The Sasanian shah Shapur II invaded Armenia and Mesopotamia. Constantine the Great died. Constantine the Great's three sons declared themselves augusti and divided their father's empire into three parts, with Constantine II (emperor) receiving Britain, Iberia, Gaul and Illyria, Constantius II Asia, Syria Palaestina and Egypt, and Constans Italy and Africa. The young Constans was placed under Constantine II's guardianship.
